title: Sun Yuting on British Empire MCQ 1

content.question: Sun Yuting’s analysis of the factors that contributed to the relative economic strength of China and Great Britain best illustrates which of the following continuities from the period 1450–1750 ?

choices.label: The expansion of empires led to the collapse of existing trade networks.
The transfer of European navigational technology expanded global trade significantly.
The global circulation of goods was fueled by European merchants’ access to Asian markets.
The establishment of state monopolies in certain industries led to higher prices for luxury items.

content.answer: The global circulation of goods was fueled by European merchants’ access to Asian markets.
